subject: Design
title: Japanese Wabi-Sabi: Beauty in Imperfection
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Japanese Wabi-Sabi: Beauty in Imperfection.

hook.text: A cracked tea bowl repaired with gold is more beautiful than a perfect one. That's wabi-sabi.

buildup.text: Japanese interiors embrace natural materials, asymmetry, and the passage of time.

discovery.text: Wabi-sabi finds beauty in weathered wood, uneven pottery, and spaces that feel lived-in.

twist.text: Western minimalism looks like wabi-sabi but misses the point â€” it seeks perfection, not imperfection.

climax.text: Wabi-sabi is the only design philosophy that celebrates decay and incompleteness as beautiful.

punchline.text: Perfection is boring. The crack is where beauty enters.

quiz.question: What does wabi-sabi celebrate in design?
options: Imperfection and the passage of time
